turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Contra (series).
turn.2: If the player gets hit once, they will lose a life along with any weapon they currently possess in some games.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Because of this, the "Contra" series is notorious for being extremely difficult.
turn.6: Even in the original arcade versions, most of the games only give limited chances to continue before forcing the player to start all over.
turn.7: How do you get extra lives?
turn.8: Extra lives are usually obtained in most games when the player reaches certain scores.
turn.9: Is there a cheat for extra lives?
turn.10: The NES version of the original "Contra" used the Konami Code (previously featured in the NES version of "Gradius") to start the game with thirty lives instead of the usual three.
turn.11: Did they fix this in later games?
turn.12: Most of the subsequent console games in the series only featured these extra lives codes in their Japanese releases, such as "Contra Spirits" (the Japanese version of "Contra III") and "Contra: Hard Corps".
